# showsNodeCount

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that indicates whether the view displays an overlay that shows physics bodies that are visible in the scene.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var showsNodeCount: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

When you enable this option, it shows the number of nodes currently in the scene’s node tree.



You may achieve additional performance gain by actually removing nodes from the node tree manually which are off screen. For example, in the case of [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKView/shouldCullNonVisibleNodes], there would be less nodes for SpriteKit to test every frame whether they’re on screen.

## Enabling Visual Statistics for Debugging

- **showsFPS**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the view displays a frame rate indicator.
- **showsDrawCount**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the view displays the number of drawing passes it needed to render the view.
- **showsQuadCount**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the view displays the number of rectangles used to render the scene.
- **showsPhysics**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the view displays physics-related debugging information.
- **showsFields**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the view displays information about physics fields in the scene.
